meanings.definition: A main beam resting across the tops of columns, specifically in classical architecture.
meanings.sent1: The architrave supported the roof above the grand columns.
meanings.sent2: The architect carefully designed the architrave to complement the classical style of the building.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel balanced on the architrave, pretending to be a tiny acrobat.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the architrave that held together the pillars of their friendship.
meanings.sent5: The architrave, like a sturdy bridge, connected the columns in a seamless arc.

meanings.definition: The molding around a door or window.
meanings.sent1: The intricate architrave added elegance to the doorway.
meanings.sent2: She painted the architrave a bright color to make the room feel more cheerful.
meanings.sent3: The cat peeked out from behind the architrave, playing a game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: His words were like an architrave framing the entrance to a new chapter in her life.
meanings.sent5: The architrave, with its delicate patterns, enhanced the beauty of the window.
